class.name: GridMap
class.description: GridMap lets you place meshes on a grid interactively. It works both from the editor and from scripts, which can help you create in-game level editors. GridMaps use a [MeshLibrary] which contains a list of tiles. Each tile is a mesh with materials plus optional collision and navigation shapes. A GridMap contains a collection of cells. Each grid cell refers to a tile in the [MeshLibrary]. All cells in the map have the same dimensions. Internally, a GridMap is split into a sparse collection of octants for efficient rendering and physics processing. Every octant has the same dimensions and can contain several cells. [b]Note:[/b] GridMap doesn't extend [VisualInstance] and therefore can't be hidden or cull masked based on [member VisualInstance.layers]. If you make a light not affect the first layer, the whole GridMap won't be lit by the light in question.

method.name: get_bake_meshes
method.description: Returns an array of [ArrayMesh]es and [Transform] references of all bake meshes that exist within the current GridMap.

method.name: get_cell_item
method.description: The [MeshLibrary] item index located at the grid-based X, Y and Z coordinates. If the cell is empty, [constant INVALID_CELL_ITEM] will be returned.

method.name: get_cell_item_orientation
method.description: The orientation of the cell at the grid-based X, Y and Z coordinates. -1 is returned if the cell is empty.

method.name: get_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the [member collision_layer].

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the [member collision_mask].

method.name: get_meshes
method.description: Returns an array of [Transform] and [Mesh] references corresponding to the non-empty cells in the grid. The transforms are specified in world space.

method.name: get_used_cells
method.description: Returns an array of [Vector3] with the non-empty cell coordinates in the grid map.

method.name: map_to_world
method.description: Returns the position of a grid cell in the GridMap's local coordinate space.

method.name: set_cell_item
method.description: Sets the mesh index for the cell referenced by its grid-based X, Y and Z coordinates. A negative item index such as [constant INVALID_CELL_ITEM] will clear the cell. Optionally, the item's orientation can be passed. For valid orientation values, see [method Basis.get_orthogonal_index].

method.name: set_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Sets an individual bit on the [member collision_layer].

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Sets an individual bit on the [member collision_mask].

method.name: world_to_map
method.description: Returns the coordinates of the grid cell containing the given point. [code]pos[/code] should be in the GridMap's local coordinate space.
